intro: Telipogon hoppii, commonly known as the Hoppi's spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Its inflorescence consists of a single spike that bears numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Telipogon hoppii is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
